transcript: there's three wine bottles and you've got a low medium high when people try it if they're the exact same wine bottle people still perceive the value of the expensive wine bottle as better now here's the flip side if I were to say go to Chipotle and you rung up and it was 30 you might feel like you got totally gypped even if Chipotle is an exceptional product it is exceptional in relation to its price that is the entire concept behind giving away free things that are exceptional if you take something that's mediocre and then you make it free people will perceive it as more valuable on the flip side if you need someone to be invested emotionally in order to succeed then raising the price gets them more invested in the outcome it's a dance between these two extremes which seem contradictory but are also both true
